case_vignette: A 32-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 1-week history of fever, weakness, diffuse abdominal pain, and multiple lumps on his body. He has recently returned to the USA from a 3-month agricultural internship in South America. Physical examination shows enlarged superficial cervical and inguinal lymph nodes. There is tender hepatomegaly. A photomicrograph of a liver biopsy sample after methenamine silver staining is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had a fever, been feeling weak, experiencing stomach pain all over, and I've noticed several lumps on my body.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
About a week now.
Have you recently traveled to any new or exotic locations?
Yes, I just got back from a 3-month agricultural internship in South America.
Have you been in close contact with any animals during your internship?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information on whether I have been in close contact with animals during the internship.
Do you have any pre-existing medical conditions, or are you taking any medications?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information about pre-existing medical conditions or medications.
Do you have a family history of any infectious diseases or conditions?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information about my family's medical history.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cutaneous Leishmaniasis
